metadata.title: CVE-2021-46943 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media:staging/intel-ipu3: Fix set_fmt error handling If there in an error duringa set_fmt, do not overwrite the previous sizes with the invalid config.Without this patch, v4l2-compliance ends up allocating 4GiB of RAM andcausing the following OOPs [ 38.662975] ipu3-imgu 0000:00:05.0: swiotlbbuffer is full (sz: 4096 bytes) [ 38.662980] DMA: Out of SW-IOMMU space for4096 bytes at device 0000:00:05.0 [ 38.663010] general protection fault:0000 [#1] PREEMPT SMP

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46943` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required
